H0.text: Five mass extinctions have occurred throughout Earth's history.

H1.text: Six mass extinctions have occurred throughout Earth's history.

H2.text: Four mass extinctions have occurred throughout Earth's history.

H3.text: Three mass extinctions have occurred throughout Earth's history.

A4.text: Since the Cambrian explosion, five further major mass extinctions have significantly exceeded the background extinction rate.

A5.text: the ongoing mass extinction caused by human activity is sometimes called the sixth mass extinction.

A6.text: במיוחד the K–Pg extinction, the fifth and most recent mass extinction event, during which 75% of life on Earth became extinct.

A7.text: the Permian–Triassic extinction event is the greatest of the 'Big Five' mass extinctions of the Phanerozoic
